column4: ok now I have managed to get it to load youtube without crashing but now the video is just a black box
what version of flashplayer are you using?
that's the most recent one. you're not trying to use the 32-bit flash plugin on a 64-bit OS, by any chance, are you?
did you do the initial flash plugin install from within firefox ( by choosing adobe plugin when you first got prompted for a plugin when trying to play youtube), from synaptic, or from terminal?
- I cant remember does it matter?

theoretically, it shouldn't, but I do recall reading somewhere that users were experiencing problems--granted, on an earlier ubuntu version--when installing directly from firefox. Why that would happen, I do not know.
- its a stupid problem to have really.. maybe I should just upgrade my distro
I just recall having issues with the new ubuntu version
hmm I might just wait till then.. just install 9.10

well, a wipe and reinstall, using Karmic this time, would probably fix the problem, but that would be awfully drastic. Maybe you should just purge the adobe plugin and its config files, add a repo for firefox 3.5, install ff 3.5, and then reinstall adobe, using the tar-gz manually downloaded from adobe's site to make sure there's no problems with putting it in the wrong place when installing?
- I wasnt going to wipe it, I was just going to upgrade

ok, just make sure you run "sudo aptitude dist-upgrade" in the terminal instead of "update manager -d" as the former allows for installs of new packages if needed. I learned that the hard way going  from Intrepid to Jaunty on a laptop i was upgrading.
